definition: lit. heart like a frisky monkey, mind like a cantering horse (idiom); fig. capricious (derog.)/to have ants in one's pants/hyperactive/adventurous and uncontrollable
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
ape
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Cancers often choose one kind of taste in chocolate and rarely then change their minds.
sentences.chinese: 巨蟹座往往選擇一種口味的巧克力就很少再心猿意馬。

sentences.english: Never think of learning another subject while studying one thing.
sentences.chinese: 在學習一樣東西的時候，切不可心猿意馬。

sentences.english: After the XiaShi always bring, also do not go to see the fix two.
sentences.chinese: 之後夏實總是過的心猿意馬，也不去看修二。

sentences.english: I lay awake thinking and mind jumping around.
sentences.chinese: 我睡不着，只顧躺着尋思，心猿意馬。

definition: affectionate/an affectionate person
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

indecisive/wavering
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to keep silent
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to force someone to do something
to shiver
to use force
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
